website_summaries.verdict: Basic, no-frills soldering iron. So cheap it could be seen as disposable.
pros: Comes with a thin tip for detailed work

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple, works well with a smoke warning.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and cheap and works well for basic soldering needs. A word of caution (the instruction manual does mention this) the thing smokes like crazy when you plug it in for the first time. It smoked so badly I had to stick it out the window. I was concerned it might even catch on fire but it didn't and the smoke stopped after about 5 minutes. Leave your windows open if you don't want your house smelling like burnt plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Really good and cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing soldering iron. I'm pretty new with soldering but I prefer this over my Weller iron. For the price it's one of those if it breaks I'll buy it again type of tools but so far I've had zero issues with it. It will smoke for around 10-15 minutes the first time you plug it in that is normal as it's just plastic burning away off the heating element. My only complaint is the grip isn't anything special and if anything the molding feels a bit sharp but I just used some hockey tape around it and it feels way nicer to use
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good product, solved the problem.
customer_reviews.text: My brother in low Chrysler Grand Caravan was vandalized. someone try to steel the van failed but destroyed the antenna at transponder key immobilizer. The Module of the original immobilizer was good but the scanning antenna was broken. The cost to fix the problem Parts + labor + towing the van to the dealer was more than $300. Using a similar immobilizer from a junk yard, after opening both immobilizers we transplanted the module from the one with bad antenna, to the other with good antenna. To do this job you need the right tool and in this case was Delcast 30 Watt Precision Tip Soldering Iron.
customer_reviews.author: blue rose

customer_reviews.title: Amazing soldering Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I hope the video I post is allowed. This tiny pencil tip Iron helped me fix the MakerBot 3D printer. For the price you can't beat this incredible value. This amazing iron repaired tthis 3D printer. The extruder replacement is about $250. Extremely very happy. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: JoeteckTips

customer_reviews.title: excellent product for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to fix my tablet and it worked great (for me). i wasnt looking for anything special, just a basic soldering iron to be used once in a while/ as needed, and this did the trick for me. as stated on the package - it did give off a burning odor/ smoke when used the first time, but it was expected. if you are looking for something super simple, this works. there is no temperature setting or anything on it, but it gets hot enough to do the job done. i would definitely buy another one if needed (since i was just looking for something cheap and effective). excellent product for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Kreisher

customer_reviews.title: Solder iron too hot, tricky to use with the provided solder
customer_reviews.text: The solder iron heated up a lot, so much so that the whole metal shaft is now all brown. The 0.8 mm solder just vaporized with the solder iron. I had to unplug it to let it cool and then quickly try to make the connection. At the end I barely soldered the two ends of the wire to the existing traces I was trying to bridge on the pcb. I had to leave the connecting wire between the two ends loose because the iron would vaporize it. Hopefully the repair will last and the connections won't come loose. At the end it got the job done, with lots of patience, so it was $8 well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Dannie

customer_reviews.title: I needed it for one project.
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a much better one. No idea where it is. So I needed a new one. But I only needed it for one project. Just connecting two wires to a circuit board. Easy peasy. This was the only one within a good price range. Yes. The quality is NOT amazing. But it did the job I needed it for, and it wasn't horrible considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool - so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make drain holes in plastic containers that I want to recycle for gardening. Heats up very quickly, makes the job seem effortless (way easier and faster than punching or drilling holes) very sturdy handle, cools down pretty quickly as well. Since I didn’t buy it for soldering I can’t comment on how well it would do, but it gets very very hot so I would imagine it would do a good job for that as well. Excellent tool - so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: LadyTug

customer_reviews.title: Great Soldering Iron for Game Gear
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this product. I just replaced 12 capacitors on Sega Game gear and believe me that it is the best soldering iron for this job. It has the perfect wattage, 30W for motherboards. Some capacitors were so closed together and I thought that i was never going to do my job, was afraid either melting the motherboard or the surrounding areas but I was surprised. This is a great tool with a precision tip and correct wattage.
customer_reviews.author: Tiko

customer_reviews.title: Save a couple bucks with this great iron.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT little soldering iron. Warms up much more quickly than my 25W Weller, and the tips are easy to change out. The pencil point is very fine, and works like a charm for through-hole soldering. I think it would probably do well with surface-mount work, but I haven't tried it. You cannot beat this soldering iron for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice little iron, I needed something small enough to solder a micro usb socket on, I ended up sharpening the tip with a file. Everything worked better than expected. I definitely recommend this for light work.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Not good for soldering automotive wiring
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get hot enough for my task. Tried to solder automotive wire pigtails or connectors for my ignition could. Not hot enough solder wouldn't take. Wires were getting way to hot before solder had a chance to take. Ended up using a higher watt iron.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fast heating iron
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron heats up very fast and maintains a hot temp. I have not been able to measure its temperature yet, so i will update that soon. It does make tining a bit hard, since the tip is not the best. Will it get the job done? sure. Is it the best? Nah
customer_reviews.author: Felix Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great for soldering electronics
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron got the job done, but it smoked quite a bit on the first use. The smoke eventually goes away, but make sure to use it in a well ventilated area. This soldering iron does not come with a stand, but I would say having an iron holder (like this) helps a lot. I used this solder with this soldering iron and it worked well:. I bought this from JacobsParts.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Works OK but smokes when first used...
customer_reviews.text: This works OK. My only gripe is that is smokes a lot when first used. I mean - a lot. So be prepared. Once it's burned in that goes away. Not sure why - possibly oil on machined parts. It doesn't affect the soldering capability but it can be a little annoying when you first plug it in. For this price not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: WMan1234Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried because of the price, but I have had zero issues. It did smoke for a few minutes when I first plugged it in like it warned, but hasn't since.
customer_reviews.author: Michaella

customer_reviews.title: power plug type?
customer_reviews.text: would not plug into any outlets here in USA, both sides were 'polarized' so I had to get out my grinder and grind off the wide spots on one of the two prongs, then it worked OK but for folks without a grinder or a file it would be hard to make this thing work!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISQNEL

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done well.
customer_reviews.text: The build is not amazing, but it got the job done really well when I needed to solder wires in my guitar. It was a good price too. I recommend this to anyone that needs a soldering iron for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect much with this given the cost however so far its working pretty good and I am very pleased with this. Only reason I am not giving 5 star is the tip is loose little bit, however, for me it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: it seems like a great iron
customer_reviews.text: Other than it wasn't hot enough for my uses, it seems like a great iron. The fine tip was great. My current use is repairing small quad copters & due to it not being hot enough, the solder wouldn't set properly. Granted I am not a pro at soldering, so take my review with a grain of salt. I have a soldering iron that reaches ~900 degrees F. which didn't produce the same problem though.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom

customer_reviews.title: Nice light duty iron
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive iron for light use. Heats quickly and maintains a reasonably stable temperature. I'd prefer a grounded plug and a better choice of tips (hence the 4/5 rating) but given its price and intended use, I have no significant complaints. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: Need Detailed Soldering done and not spend a lot for an iron? THIS is the answer.
customer_reviews.text: I had an electrical item with a circuit board, and one thing kept coming loose. This iron is PERFECT for working on precision detail. From what I've saved in purchasing new items, this iron has paid for itself a few times over.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Pankowski

customer_reviews.title: Works OK for a cheap tool
customer_reviews.text: Needed to solder one electrical connection. The price was right. It took awhile to warm up and start to work and it did the job OK. Came with some solder too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this little tool... Very basic and for beginners
customer_reviews.author: Andrea E.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I used it for guitar electronics and it was perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: joebor

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quick and works well on solder joints and pcb through hole solders
customer_reviews.author: Bob law bla

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for two weeks of mild use.
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally ordered two of these - which was a mistake and a good thing. The first one I used only lasted 2 weeks of mild use before it stopped heating. It does a decent job when it's working - smells terrible when first started (lots of smoke). Wish I had returned both and gotten a higher quality soldering iron.
customer_reviews.author: Maine_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best soldering Iron for under $10
customer_reviews.text: One of the best soldering irons I have used. It gets hot enough to melt solder in under 3 minutes and cools quickly as well. The fine tip makes soldering small components very easy. The only downside is that the handle gets fairly hot if you keep the iron plugged in for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Canaday

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for Xbox one analog
customer_reviews.text: Did the job of desoldering and soldering the analog stick to my xbox one controller with ease. Fine tip made accuracy easier than with my RadioShack unit. For the price it cannot be beat. I solder things a couple of time per year and this will be my go to for fine detail work from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Perfect for what I use it for (model railroading). Takes a few minutes for it to heat up and I've only used it with .031 wire solder, but I haven't had any trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Very good soldering pen. At the right price
customer_reviews.text: Good device for the price paid. Couldn't ask for more Keep the good work
customer_reviews.author: HOPE BLIZZARD WOLF

customer_reviews.title: Good but should've payed for more
customer_reviews.text: I suppose that it works fine, it melts solder off of a roll just fine but I believe I should have went for something a bit more expensive maybe with better heat output as it failed to melt the solder from my laptops D.C. Jack that I am attempting to replace.
customer_reviews.author: caleb waterwash

customer_reviews.title: Misleading pictures
customer_reviews.text: The product i received was not the item pictured, i ordered a "precision tip" and got something far from it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Sanders-Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made:
customer_reviews.text: A very well made little iron for such a reasonable price. I looked at Radio Shack, and they wanted over $20- for one not as good as this little one.
customer_reviews.author: LouiseS

customer_reviews.title: Works great, happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller jobs. Bought for soldering wires to LED light strips. Unfortunately I am terrible at soldering, but it's not the iron's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Came with the WRONG plug. So... had to cut it off and solder on an american plug.... Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: CW M.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Just will not heat up enough to melt the solder.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle B.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it’s garbage.
customer_reviews.text: First use had this thing giving off a ton of probably-super-toxic smoke. It worked though. Definitely wish I bought a better iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One use junk
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Nice looking packaging design, but the product is worthless. As soon as I plugged it in (well, not as soon as I did because it took quite a while to heat up), it started smoking from the inside. On the first light use with rosin core solder (not acid flux), the tip started to erode or melt away with a nice hole in the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Someone else

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to fix my speakers...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soldering iron to fix a contact on a wire on one of my computer speakers. Worked just fine for me. It also comes with rosin core solder, so I had everything I needed. Just for $6 (including shipping) I fixed my speaker set, which, hopefully, will serve me for few more years.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thing heats up quick and the small tip makes it easy to get into the tight spaces on small jobs. this is a good buy for a person who's needing that extra small soldering iron.
customer_reviews.author: TEXtownJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for what I used it for - poking air ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what I used it for - poking air holes in acrylic enclosures for my tarantulas! Has a weird smell to begin with but it fades away.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT soldering iron w/solder for people on budgets
customer_reviews.text: Great solder iron w/solder for a great price. Would recommend to anyone on a budget
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did its job pretty well, that being said
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a cheap soldering iron, but you get what you pay for. It did its job pretty well, that being said.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It's brand new and it smokes as soon as you plug it in...
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: The "Best" cheap iron
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all the cheap irons and this one is the best. It gets up to temperature very fast and the tip is decent quality. Solder sticks to tip for easy tinning. Way better than the Harbor Freight iron which is junk right out the package.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Paul

customer_reviews.title: Last for two uses, heat stopped
customer_reviews.text: Last for two uses, the heat stopped. Disappointed. Did not expect too much anyway.
customer_reviews.author: yuhua

customer_reviews.title: best 5.95 I've spent this year
customer_reviews.text: great replacement for my ancient Weller pencil - works great
customer_reviews.author: Tampajock

customer_reviews.title: Not a super high quality iron
customer_reviews.text: Not a super high quality iron, but for quick basic jobs it is handy to have in my tool box
customer_reviews.author: Average dad

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Best soldering pencil I found with a very small tip for the hard to work on projects.
customer_reviews.author: KWeaver0907

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Though it was my first time using a soldering iron, I was able to repair some costume jewelry with it easily.
customer_reviews.author: H. M. MCCALL

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow on heating up but good job.
customer_reviews.text: Just what is needed. It works. A bit slow on heating up but good job.
customer_reviews.author: Dan the Bug Man

customer_reviews.title: ... this thing solders well and looks retro so I like it.
customer_reviews.text: not an expert but this thing solders well and looks retro so I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Item was defective, hard to describe but basically the power cord had two large pongs that didn't fit in my socket. Odd I know huh? If only I had a soldering iron to solder on a correct power cord to it...
customer_reviews.author: David Sai

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product at a low price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product at a low price. The tip is a bit wobbly that's why only three stars...Built well otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sannella

customer_reviews.title: NIFTY
customer_reviews.text: Nifty for micro-soldering on circuit boards. Comes with a good quality solder too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Conyngham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Although it doesn't get very hot, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Mei

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good price. works like a charm. great product for average consumers like me.
customer_reviews.author: Tan.H

customer_reviews.title: Nice iron for electronics work.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for soldering small electronics projects. Make sure to use thin solder and you'll be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Consumer

customer_reviews.title: BAD
customer_reviews.text: Bad, didn't heat up enought at the point to melt the solder
customer_reviews.author: Janette Litaker

customer_reviews.title: Precision tip soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price and it performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Castellaneta

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Light smoke when first plugged in but works great with a Hakko tip cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: used it for little over an hour and then stopped working. you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: pogo86

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, it did smoke alot at first, but still a great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little iron. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great even though one screw holding the tip had stripped threads
customer_reviews.author: Klintehamn

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great...
customer_reviews.text: So far no problems with this item,heated up pretty quick and did the job just fine..For the price it was well worth it and I would recommend this product to any one with small soldering jobs..
customer_reviews.author: George William Giles

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but works good enough for what I need it for
customer_reviews.author: Philbert

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Nice iron. Heats up pretty fast. Needle point is great for PCB's
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works, but only after it smokes up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L. Gregoriou

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: As I expected this product came with a well defined package. Soldering iron works good. It's pencil tip shape helped me to fix very thin wire with electronics board. I'll recommend this to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it several times on small jobs, works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fisicaro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great!! nice fine tip for smaller work. Disposable at this price :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for what I needed It. I will certainly continue to use it. It heats fast and its pointy enough for tiny spaces.
customer_reviews.author: MARISOL

customer_reviews.title: Soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Heats up pretty quick. This is made for small soldering projects. Not for wire I would guess thicker than 18 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Mak

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for small job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to fix his handheld gaming system. It worked very well. He said it smoked when he first plugged it in, but after that, it worked as expected and the price was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: L. B.

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, good bargain
customer_reviews.text: The product was just as described and performs as promised, getting hot enough to desolder. I haven't had it long though, so I'm not sure how it will hold up. It is definitely a good bargain if you are looking for a quick solder/desolder.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas DeRusha

customer_reviews.title: w00t
customer_reviews.text: fantastic inexpensive 30 watt soldering iron perfect for repair soldering sensitive electronic components
customer_reviews.author: Kilgoree

customer_reviews.title: its ok for beginner soldering
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't heat up to what I needed it to. But works
customer_reviews.author: zach boogy

customer_reviews.title: did what it said it would. grea value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Did what it said it would. Got the job done. No complaints on this one
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great? 5/5
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Cons: the pointy tip makes it a bit hard to hold solder if you can't hold it with your other hand
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Low wattage for solder
customer_reviews.text: Does not produce enough heat. You have to wait a lot and push hard to the solder to melt it.
customer_reviews.author: Sahika Gunten Guney

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I needed a soldering iron that had a blunter tip ... didn't expect this product to have such a fine pointed tip. This product if better suited for circuit board soldering not normal electrical wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Gerold A. Goudy

customer_reviews.title: Little tool Big function
customer_reviews.text: Just get the stuff and it works perfectly. It is cheap but reliable. The only con is that they do not offer a holder.
customer_reviews.author: Congwei Wu

customer_reviews.title: Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Better than other products I bought at other stores. Warms up quick and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: axenga

customer_reviews.title: WOULD PROBABLY BURN DOWN YOUR HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: It didn't even work! I took it apart and I couldn't figure out why. It just never got hot. Furthermore its super flimsy. Like it's ready to burn your house down. Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Solid soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a no thrills soldering iron. It heats up pretty quickly and that is good. Certainly gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: uknow223

customer_reviews.title: Garbage that should come with a warning label!!
customer_reviews.text: It started smoking after I plugged it in. If I want to pay for shipping I can send it back and recoup $1. I'll pass but please learn from my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: TEW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smells terrible when its warming up but that goes away when its fully heated. Works.
customer_reviews.author: Phant

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It looked good, but I lost it before I could use it :)
customer_reviews.author: Opiessence

customer_reviews.title: The solder and solder tip are great but I received the wrong soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: The solder and the tip that came with the soldering iron are the sizes that I need but I have to order the soldering iron again because they sent me one that is 6A 250V instead of the one that shown on the page that's 110V - 120V
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: No Solder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I believe it came with solder but it didn't so it set me back on my project.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Saget

customer_reviews.title: kind of cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I know I know, I didn't pay much. But this soldering iron was a bit of a disappointment. I probably should have just sent it back.. The price wasn't worth the effort though... its basic, but it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Bud77

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and cheap. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It started Smoking as soon as I plugged it in, and I'm pretty sure it's not just a defective one. It is very cheaply made and it isn't worth lighting your house on fire buying one, go for quality when buying things like this. It doesn't even have any indicator that it's plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: Shoddy build quality, get something with a brand name. This one was obviously a chinese knockoff. I'm afraid it will start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: horrible
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece off garbage if anyone buys it i feel bad for them the first day i got it it broke that crab dude come on.
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: To replace my very old Radio Shack unit. NOW my soldering will be so easy and able to do good looking work tinning wires! I have soldered electronics and tinning wires for over 48 years. For over 5 years working in Electronics Repair.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Smith

product_meta.title: Delcast 30 Watt Precision Tip Soldering Iron
product_meta.description:
Size:30W Soldering IronEl delcast 30jy punta de lápiz es ideal para la electrónica de soldadura de hierro de soldadura. La plancha de baja potencia funciona a una temperatura que es seguro de usar en calor sensible Electronics PCB. Tiene un polarizadas US Plug de 2 Clavijas (uno Prong es más amplio que el otro) que ayuda a que permanezca conectado a la salida de potencia. El soldador de hierro 30jy viene preinstalado con un buen punto de precisión punta de soldadura. La punta puede ser reemplazado por aflojando los tornillos en cada lado de la barrel.
El opcionalmente incluido colofonia Core Solder tiene una relación de Eutectic Recording de 63% de estaño 37% de plomo. Tiene el más bajo punto de fusión (183 °C o 361.4 ° ft) de cualquier otra combinación de estaño y plomo soldadura.
Especificaciones
De entrada: 110 – 120 V
De salida: 30 W
About delcast
Nuestra misión es proporcionar una fiable precisión Fuente de go-to para herramientas de mano por lograr el equilibrio ideal de forma y función, precio. Detrás de cada delcast producto es un compromiso con la calidad y rendimiento duradero. Cada compra de una herramienta de delcast viene respaldado por una garantía de reemplazo de por vida sin complicaciones, garantizado. Su satisfacción es nuestra promesa.
